skills.title: Skills
skill.html.title: HTML
skill.html.back: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the skeleton of the page, responsible for organizing and defining the elements that appear on the screen, serving as the base for CSS (style) and JavaScript (functionality).
skill.css.title: CSS
skill.css.back: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to define the visual style of a webpage. While HTML structures the content, CSS controls colors, sizes, fonts, spacing, layouts, animations and visual effects.
skill.js.title: JavaScript
skill.js.back: JavaScript is the programming language that brings interactivity and dynamism to web pages. It allows page elements to respond to user actions such as clicks, typing and mouse movement, and enables animations, form validation, API requests, updating content without reloading the page and much more.
skill.react.title: React
skill.react.back: React is a JavaScript library used to build user interfaces quickly, efficiently and in an organized manner. It works with components, which are reusable blocks of code representing interface elements such as buttons, cards, menus, forms etc.
skill.node.title: Node.js
skill.node.back: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime environment for server-side execution. While traditional JavaScript runs only in the browser, Node.js allows the use of JavaScript to build back-ends, APIs, servers and complete applications outside the browser.
skill.uiux.title: UI / UX
skill.uiux.back: UX is about how the user feels while using a product. It involves research, testing, flows, information architecture and usability to ensure everything is simple, intuitive and enjoyable. UI is about visual appearance and interaction. It defines colors, typography, buttons, spacing, icons and all graphical elements the user sees and interacts with.
